knimeNode.name: Tableau Writer (Hyper)
knimeNode.shortDescription: Writes the input table as Tableau Data Extract (Hyper) file.

intro.p: Writes the input table as Tableau Data Extract (Hyper) file. This node uses the Tableau SDK library to write the file.
In order to use this library the user needs to perform the installation steps as described on the Tableau SDK website (see below).

tab.name: Main Configuration
tab.option: Choose the file to write to.
If not selected, the node will refuse to overwrite the file if it already exists (execution will fail)

ol.li: Download the Java version of the Tableau Extract API 2.0 for your system (Windows, Mac, or Linux).
Extract the archive to a location of your choice.

Update environment variables such as PATH on your system (see point 4
here). If you are not familiar with setting variables on Windows, have a look at this page.
On Windows systems: The library relies on the "Visual C++ Redistributable Packages for Visual Studio 2013" to be installed on the system (for download from microsoft.com)

ports.inPort: Data to be written as Tableau Data Extract (Hyper). Only primitive types (string, numbers, dates) are used -- all remaining columns are ignored.
